comments.text:
I think I'm seeing the same thing;  both my main and work machines (Fedora 28 on both) are failing a couple of times a day, the backtrace is:

(gdb) where
#0  0x00007f429b7870d8 in mozilla::ipc::MessageChannel::OnChannelErrorFromLink() (this=0x7f42aa2c6128) at /usr/src/debug/firefox-59.0.2-1.fc28.x86_64/ipc/glue/MessageChannel.cpp:2534
2534	            MOZ_CRASH("Aborting on channel error.");
#1  0x00007f429bcc4eb3 in mozilla::ipc::ProcessLink::OnChannelError() (this=0x7f428db4fd30) at /usr/src/debug/firefox-59.0.2-1.fc28.x86_64/ipc/glue/MessageLink.cpp:393
#2  0x00007f429bcae77a in event_persist_closure (ev=<optimized out>, base=0x7f42aa2c1400) at /usr/src/debug/firefox-59.0.2-1.fc28.x86_64/ipc/chromium/src/third_party/libevent/event.c:1580
#3  0x00007f429bcae77a in event_process_active_single_queue (base=base@entry=0x7f42aa2c1400, max_to_process=max_to_process@entry=2147483647, endtime=endtime@entry=0x0, activeq=<optimized out>)
    at /usr/src/debug/firefox-59.0.2-1.fc28.x86_64/ipc/chromium/src/third_party/libevent/event.c:1639
#4  0x00007f429bcaed8f in event_process_active (base=0x7f42aa2c1400) at /usr/src/debug/firefox-59.0.2-1.fc28.x86_64/ipc/chromium/src/third_party/libevent/event.c:1738
#5  0x00007f429bcaed8f in event_base_loop (base=0x7f42aa2c1400, flags=flags@entry=1) at /usr/src/debug/firefox-59.0.2-1.fc28.x86_64/ipc/chromium/src/third_party/libevent/event.c:1961
#6  0x00007f429bc943ce in base::MessagePumpLibevent::Run(base::MessagePump::Delegate*) (this=0x7f42aa251a40, delegate=0x7f429811cd00) at /usr/src/debug/firefox-59.0.2-1.fc28.x86_64/ipc/chromium/src/base/message_pump_libevent.cc:381
#7  0x00007f429bc96849 in MessageLoop::RunInternal() (this=0x7f429811cd00) at /usr/src/debug/firefox-59.0.2-1.fc28.x86_64/ipc/chromium/src/base/message_loop.cc:326
#8  0x00007f429bc96849 in MessageLoop::RunHandler() (this=0x7f429811cd00) at /usr/src/debug/firefox-59.0.2-1.fc28.x86_64/ipc/chromium/src/base/message_loop.cc:319
#9  0x00007f429bc96849 in MessageLoop::Run() (this=this@entry=0x7f429811cd00) at /usr/src/debug/firefox-59.0.2-1.fc28.x86_64/ipc/chromium/src/base/message_loop.cc:299
#10 0x00007f429bca4785 in base::Thread::ThreadMain() (this=0x7f42aa2263e8) at /usr/src/debug/firefox-59.0.2-1.fc28.x86_64/ipc/chromium/src/base/thread.cc:181
#11 0x00007f429bc93eee in ThreadFunc(void*) (closure=<optimized out>) at /usr/src/debug/firefox-59.0.2-1.fc28.x86_64/ipc/chromium/src/base/platform_thread_posix.cc:38
#12 0x00007f42ab572564 in start_thread () at /lib64/libpthread.so.0
#13 0x00007f42aa76431f in clone () at /lib64/libc.so.6

Note the 'mChannelState is mozilla::ipc::ChannelConnected.

I've had it fail at quite a few different activities; scrolling through videos, clicking on the 'tick' in google photos; and a bunch of others - can't nail down a single cause.  My work machine has no extra codecs, my home machine has a load of ffmpeg - so there's nothing common between them.  I don't think I'd seen it before fedora28 though - it's currently Firefox 59.0.2.

I'd filed it as Fedora bug:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1568097
comments.author: mozilla@treblig.org

comments.text:
Created attachment 8973782
Marionette test

I can replicate that failure all the time on MacOS when running the above Marionette test in headless mode:

`mach marionette-test --headless -vv --gecko-log - %path_to_py_file%`

It always results in a:

> Hit MOZ_CRASH(Aborting on channel error.) at /builds/worker/workspace/build/src/ipc/glue/MessageChannel.cpp:2555
> [GFX1-]: Receive IPC close with reason=AbnormalShutdown

I will see if I can narrow down the regression range (if there is one) a bit further.
comments.author: hskupin@gmail.com

comments.text: It looks like I cannot really do a regression test with artifact builds which I'm using locally. So if a developer could have a look at this and run the test it might be faster.
comments.author: hskupin@gmail.com

comments.text:
Could this bug be related to https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1461041 ?
FF 60 ESR was crashing on my AArch64 box with the exact same results. But removing the "-fno-delete-null-pointer-checks" compiler flag fixes this for me.
comments.author: cgrobertson@suse.com

assigned_to_detail.name: nobody@mozilla.org
assigned_to_detail.real_name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it
